title: Upper Bridge (Warsaw, Missouri)
text:
Upper Bridge, also known as the Warsaw Swinging Bridge, is a historic cable <a href="suspension%20bridge">suspension bridge</a> located at <a href="Warsaw%2C%20Missouri">Warsaw</a>, <a href="Benton%20County%2C%20Missouri">Benton County, Missouri</a>. It originally opened in 1904 and rebuilt in 1928 after a <a href="tornado">tornado</a> in 1924. It measures long, and spans the <a href="Osage%20River">Osage River</a>. It has a span between steel towers.
It was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1999.
